summary: This document is an email chain from October 2020 among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel and a contractor regarding the final review and production of discovery materials, likely related to the case against Jeffrey Epstein or an associate. The discussion focuses on redactions, stamping, cover letters to defense counsel, and the identification of documents pertaining to inmate Nicholas Tartaglione and a person referred to as 'Touhy'.

persons.name: Noel
persons.context: Recipient of a discovery production cover letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Thomas
persons.context: Recipient of a discovery production cover letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: A subject of the document review; emails concern his conditions of confinement and an incident where he was questioned about an attack on Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to an incident where Tartaglione was questioned about an attack on him, and where Epstein informed a psychologist about Tartaglione.

connections.description: Both were inmates at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC); documents reference Tartaglione being questioned about an attack on Epstein.
The USAO is preparing and sending discovery materials to defense counsel Noel.
The USAO is preparing and sending discovery materials to defense counsel Thomas.

events.title: Discovery Review Completion
events.description: A contractor completes review of email files for redaction, flagging uncertain portions related to Tartaglione and Epstein.

events.title: Finalization of Discovery Production
events.description: Final cover letters are approved, and discovery materials are prepared for production to defense counsel via USAfx.

events.title: Anonymizing Index Review
events.description: Final review and approval of an anonymizing index before sending out discovery productions.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office was finalizing a large discovery production for defense counsel in a case involving Nicholas Tartaglione and references to Jeffrey Epstein.
Email chains reviewed included discussions about an incident where Tartaglione was questioned regarding an attack on Jeffrey Epstein while both were at the MCC.
The review process specifically sought to identify documents related solely to Tartaglione's conditions of confinement and emails with a person referred to as 'Touhy'.
Multiple USAO personnel and a contractor were involved in a meticulous process of redaction, stamping, and creating an anonymizing index for the discovery materials.
